text: KABUL At least one person was killed and two were injured on Saturday in Afghanistans capital Kabul as ten rockets hit various parts on the city, officials said.A Taliban spokesman said that his group was not behind the attack as they continued talks with the Afghan governments representatives to end nearly two decades of war.Security officials said it was not clear if militants of Afghan affiliate of Islamic State, known as Islamic State Khorasan, were involved in the attack.Last month, a barrage of rockets hit residential areas in Kabul, killing at least eight people and wounding more than 30.The regional Islamic State group had claimed responsibility for the November attack.
